intro: Tithymalus helioscopius subsp. dominii, commonly known as the Alpine tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
